trial_identification.studytitle: Prevalence of epiphora in women with early breast cancer receiving adjuvant docetaxel-based chemotherapy
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A study to assess the incidence of tearing as a consequence of docetaxel chemotherapy in women with early breast cancer

interventions.interventions: To measure the incidence of tearing by symptom review. clinical examination and Computerised tomography Dacrocystogram from baseline to 3 months following completion of chemotherapy

primaryOutcome.outcome: To assess the frequency and severity of tearing in a group of consecutive patients receiving adjuvant docetaxel-based chemotherapy at 2 centres
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline, mid chemotherapy and 3 months after chemotherapy
Baseline, after 3 cycles and at 12 weeks following chmoetherapy

primaryOutcome.outcome: Proportion of patient who develop lacrimal duct stenosis
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Before, during and after chemotherapy given

secondaryOutcome.outcome: To assess the efficacy of a conservative approach versus surgical intervention in a subset of patients with documented lacrimal stenosis
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline, mid chemotherapy and 3 months after chemotherapy
Before, during and after chemotherapy given

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Women with early breast cancer receiving docetaxel-based chemotherapy
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Tearing present prior to commencement of chemotherapy

fundingsource.fundingaddress: sanofi-aventis Talavera Corporate Centre Building D 12-24 Talavera Road Macquarie Park, NSW 2113 +61 (0)2 8666 2000

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study will monitor whether you develop tearing and if so, how frequent and severe this complaint is. It will involve assessment of theeyes before start chemotherapy, during and at the end of treatment.
ethicsAndSummary.publication: no publication was ever made for this trial
